articles.author: Sara Moniuszko
articles.title: Americans started drinking more during the pandemic, and a new study shows that lasted for years - CBS News
articles.description: Pandemic-prompted drinking persists, according to a new study that shows a continued increase in alcohol use.
articles.content:
The COVID-19 pandemic was associated with increases in stress-related drinking and alcohol-related deaths, and new research suggests drinking didn't stop as things returned to normal. 
In the study,… [+1564 chars]
